content.title: Financial Assistance To Destitute Children Scheme
content.department: Department of Social Justice and Empowerment
content.details: The scheme 'Financial Assistance to Destitute Children Scheme (FADCS)' was launched by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of Haryana in the year 1984. This is a state scheme under which parents/guardians of children up to the age of 21 years who are deprived of parental support or care by reason of death, continued absence from the home of father for the last 2 years, or father/mother has been sentenced to imprisonment for a period not less than one year or physical or mental incapacity of a parent, are paid financial assistance subject to the maximum for two children of one family as per eligibility criteria laid down in the scheme. Initially the rate of financial assistance of ₹200/- per month per child w.e.f. 01.03.2009. The rate of pension under this scheme is ₹500/- per month per child from January 2014, ₹700/- w.e.f. 01-11-2016, ₹900/- w.e.f. 01-11-2017, ₹1100/- w.e.f. 01-11-2018, ₹1350/- w.e.f. 01.01.2020, ₹1600/- w.e.f. 01.04.2021 and ₹1850/- (one child) w.e.f. 01.04.2023.
benefits: Rate of Allowance: ₹1850/- per month per child subject to the maximum for two children of one family.
eligibility: Domicile of Haryana and residing in Haryana State.
A child under twenty-one years of age.
Income of parents/guardians from all sources should not exceed ₹2,00,000/- per annum.

Children have been deprived of parental support or care for the following reasons: Reason of Death, Continued absence from home of his father for the last 2 years, Father/Mother has been sentenced to imprisonment for a period not less than one year, Physical/Mental incapacity of the Parent.
exclusions: In case the guardian or any parent of the child is employed by any Government or by any Local/Statutory Body or any organization substantially financed by any Government or Local/Statutory Body or who is drawing pension or family pension therefrom will not be eligible under the scheme.

Pension wherever occurring in any Government notification concerning Social Security Benefit means and includes, income received or accrued from accumulated earnings, including schemes: Provident Funds, or Annuities from any source including Commercial Banks, Financial Institutions, or Insurance.
content.application_process: Offline and Online. The applicant needs to visit the office of the Social Welfare Department (DSWO) in his/her Block/District and collect the application form. The application form can also be downloaded from the official website.
documents_required: Age Proof: A certificate from the Head of an Educational or Technical Institution last attended, or a certificate from a Gazetted Officer of the Central or State Government personally known to the applicant; or an affidavit attested by a First Class Magistrate.
Residential Proof: Ration Card, Voter Card, Voter list showing the name of the applicant along with his/her Photograph, or self-declaration along with any other documentary proof.
Other Documents: Aadhaar Card (Optional), Saving Bank Account detail of the applicant with a photocopy of the passbook, Family I.D.
Documents in support of deprivation: Death certificate of father, Legal guardian certificate, Destitute Certificate.

faqs.question: What is the aim of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The aim of these rules is to extend financial assistance to such of children who are fatherless or whose Parents/guardian get incapacitated due to physical injury or serious disease or become the victim of mental instability or has been sentenced to imprisonment or is untraceable or due to incapacity to any other similar factor.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Social Justice And Empowerment, Government of Haryana.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The children who are deprived of parental support or care by reason of death, continued absence from the home of father for the last 2 years, or father/mother has been sentenced to imprisonment for a period not less than one year or physical or mental incapacity of a parent, are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Can a general category applicant be eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is for all categories of applicants.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Haryana State?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana State.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance of ₹1850 per month per child up to the age of 21 years will be given to the eligible beneficiary.

faqs.question: How many children will get financial assistance in a family?
faqs.answer: Benefits extend up to two children in a family only.

faqs.question: What is the income criterion under the scheme?
faqs.answer: To get the benefits of the scheme, the income of parents/guardians should not exceed ₹2,00,000/- per annum.

faqs.question: Who is excluded from the scheme?
faqs.answer: The guardian or any parent of the child is employed by any Government or by any Local/Statutory Body or any organization substantially financed by any Government or Local/Statutory Body or who is drawing pension or family pension therefrom will not be eligible under the scheme.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The eligible applicant may apply through both online & offline modes.

faqs.question: Where can an applicant find the application form?
faqs.answer: The application form may be downloaded from the official website of the department.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply online under the scheme?
faqs.answer: For online application, the applicant should visit the Official Portal - Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
